    Scraping USADA prohibited associations

    scraping-usada-proh-assoc.Rmd

    Packages:

    library(dopingdata)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(stringr)
library(forcats)
library(lubridate)
library(readr)
library(readxl)
library(janitor)
library(anytime)
library(robotstxt)
options(robotstxt_warn = FALSE)

    USADA prohibited association data

    The data Iâ€™ll be downloading comes from USADA prohibited association table.

    Use your manners

    Because this package is built on top of the efforts of the fine people who collected, organized, and shared their data, weâ€™re going to use the polite package for harvesting the HTML tables.

    To install this package, run the code below:

    remotes::install_github("dmi3kno/polite")
library(polite)

    polite has many options for ethically scraping data (check out the package website for more information), but Iâ€™ve chosen to follow the handy polite template:

    polite::use_manners()

    Check robots.txt

    Iâ€™ll check the robots.txt file before scraping the website:

    # retrieval
rtxt <- robotstxt::robotstxt(domain = "https://www.usada.org/")

# printing
rtxt$check(
  paths = c("news/", 
            "news/prohibited-association/"),
  bot   = "*"
)
#> [1] TRUE TRUE

    Both paths are TRUE.

    Iâ€™ll also check the domain with robotstxt::get_robotstxt():

    rt <- robotstxt::get_robotstxt(
  domain = "https://www.usada.org/news/prohibited-association/")
# printing
cat(rt[1])
#> # robots.txt overwrite by: on_suspect_content
#> 
#> User-agent: *
#> Allow: /

    I can see the Allow: / configuration gives us access to download the data.

    Scraping with polite and rvest

    Below are the steps used to scrape the prohibited associations table:

    usada_url = "https://www.usada.org/news/prohibited-association/"
usada_nodes <- polite::bow(usada_url) |> 
  polite::scrape() |> 
  rvest::html_nodes("table") 
usada_prohib_assoc_raw <- rvest::html_table(usada_nodes[[1]])
    dplyr::glimpse(usada_prohib_assoc_raw)
#> Rows: 18
#> Columns: 2
#> $ NAME                            <chr> "Chavez, Bernabe", "Prempeh, Ernest", â€¦
#> $ `SUSPENSION ENDS\n(mm/dd/yyyy)` <chr> "09/01/2025", "Indefinite*", "07/26/20â€¦

    Process text

    The process_text() function will lowercase the all the text in the dataset. It also applies janitor::clean_names() to the column names:

    usada_prohib_assoc_pro <- process_text(usada_prohib_assoc_raw)
dplyr::glimpse(usada_prohib_assoc_pro)
#> Rows: 18
#> Columns: 2
#> $ name                       <chr> "chavez, bernabe", "prempeh, ernest", "daniâ€¦
#> $ suspension_ends_mm_dd_yyyy <chr> "09/01/2025", "indefinite*", "07/26/2025", â€¦

    Column names

    We can change the name of suspension_ends_mm_dd_yyyy to suspend_end:

    dplyr::rename(usada_prohib_assoc_pro, 
  suspend_end = suspension_ends_mm_dd_yyyy)
#> # A tibble: 18 Ã— 2
#>    name                 suspend_end
#>    <chr>                <chr>      
#>  1 chavez, bernabe      09/01/2025 
#>  2 prempeh, ernest      indefinite*
#>  3 daniels, jamaal      07/26/2025 
#>  4 pearson, keir        lifetime   
#>  5 glasgow, scott       08/09/2023 
#>  6 brown, jeffrey       09/29/2023 
#>  7 salazar, alberto     09/29/2023 
#>  8 bell, kenta          lifetime   
#>  9 gingras, michael     01/15/2029 
#> 10 drummond, jon        12/16/2022 
#> 11 bruyneel, johan      lifetime   
#> 12 marti, jose          06/11/2027 
#> 13 celaya lazama, pedro lifetime   
#> 14 ferrari, dr. michele lifetime   
#> 15 leinders, dr. geert  lifetime   
#> 16 korchemny, remi      lifetime   
#> 17 stewart, raymond     lifetime   
#> 18 graham, trevor       lifetime

    suspend_type

    Create an indicator variable (suspend_type) for three categories of suspensions: temporary, lifetime or indefinite*

    dplyr::rename(usada_prohib_assoc_pro, 
  suspend_end = suspension_ends_mm_dd_yyyy) |> 
  dplyr::mutate(
    suspend_type = dplyr::case_when(
      stringr::str_detect(suspend_end, "lifetime") ~ "lifetime",
      stringr::str_detect(suspend_end, "indefinite*") ~ "indefinite*",
      TRUE ~ "temporary"))
#> # A tibble: 18 Ã— 3
#>    name                 suspend_end suspend_type
#>    <chr>                <chr>       <chr>       
#>  1 chavez, bernabe      09/01/2025  temporary   
#>  2 prempeh, ernest      indefinite* indefinite* 
#>  3 daniels, jamaal      07/26/2025  temporary   
#>  4 pearson, keir        lifetime    lifetime    
#>  5 glasgow, scott       08/09/2023  temporary   
#>  6 brown, jeffrey       09/29/2023  temporary   
#>  7 salazar, alberto     09/29/2023  temporary   
#>  8 bell, kenta          lifetime    lifetime    
#>  9 gingras, michael     01/15/2029  temporary   
#> 10 drummond, jon        12/16/2022  temporary   
#> 11 bruyneel, johan      lifetime    lifetime    
#> 12 marti, jose          06/11/2027  temporary   
#> 13 celaya lazama, pedro lifetime    lifetime    
#> 14 ferrari, dr. michele lifetime    lifetime    
#> 15 leinders, dr. geert  lifetime    lifetime    
#> 16 korchemny, remi      lifetime    lifetime    
#> 17 stewart, raymond     lifetime    lifetime    
#> 18 graham, trevor       lifetime    lifetime

    suspend_end

    The suspend_end contains dates and represent the date the suspension ends.

    dplyr::rename(usada_prohib_assoc_pro, 
  suspend_end = suspension_ends_mm_dd_yyyy) |> 
  dplyr::mutate(
    suspend_type = dplyr::case_when(
      stringr::str_detect(suspend_end, "lifetime") ~ "lifetime",
      stringr::str_detect(suspend_end, "indefinite*") ~ "indefinite*",
      TRUE ~ "temporary"),
    suspend_end = dplyr::case_when(
      stringr::str_detect(suspend_end, "lifetime|indefinite*") ~ NA_character_,
      TRUE ~ suspend_end),
    suspend_end = lubridate::mdy(suspend_end))
#> # A tibble: 18 Ã— 3
#>    name                 suspend_end suspend_type
#>    <chr>                <date>      <chr>       
#>  1 chavez, bernabe      2025-09-01  temporary   
#>  2 prempeh, ernest      NA          indefinite* 
#>  3 daniels, jamaal      2025-07-26  temporary   
#>  4 pearson, keir        NA          lifetime    
#>  5 glasgow, scott       2023-08-09  temporary   
#>  6 brown, jeffrey       2023-09-29  temporary   
#>  7 salazar, alberto     2023-09-29  temporary   
#>  8 bell, kenta          NA          lifetime    
#>  9 gingras, michael     2029-01-15  temporary   
#> 10 drummond, jon        2022-12-16  temporary   
#> 11 bruyneel, johan      NA          lifetime    
#> 12 marti, jose          2027-06-11  temporary   
#> 13 celaya lazama, pedro NA          lifetime    
#> 14 ferrari, dr. michele NA          lifetime    
#> 15 leinders, dr. geert  NA          lifetime    
#> 16 korchemny, remi      NA          lifetime    
#> 17 stewart, raymond     NA          lifetime    
#> 18 graham, trevor       NA          lifetime

    usada_proh_assoc_pro

    The resulting processed dataset will be named usada_proh_assoc_pro and exported to inst/extdata/

    usada_proh_assoc_pro <- dplyr::rename(usada_prohib_assoc_pro, 
  suspend_end = suspension_ends_mm_dd_yyyy) |> 
  dplyr::mutate(suspend_type = dplyr::case_when(
      stringr::str_detect(suspend_end, "lifetime") ~ "lifetime",
      stringr::str_detect(suspend_end, "indefinite*") ~ "indefinite*",
      TRUE ~ "temporary"),
    suspend_end = dplyr::case_when(
      stringr::str_detect(suspend_end, "lifetime|indefinite*") ~ NA_character_,
      TRUE ~ suspend_end),
    suspend_end = lubridate::mdy(suspend_end))
dplyr::glimpse(usada_proh_assoc_pro)
#> Rows: 18
#> Columns: 3
#> $ name         <chr> "chavez, bernabe", "prempeh, ernest", "daniels, jamaal", â€¦
#> $ suspend_end  <date> 2025-09-01, NA, 2025-07-26, NA, 2023-08-09, 2023-09-29, â€¦
#> $ suspend_type <chr> "temporary", "indefinite*", "temporary", "lifetime", "temâ€¦

    Export raw data

    Iâ€™ll export the raw data into the inst/extdata/raw/ folder using export_extdata()

    export_extdata(
  x = usada_prohib_assoc_raw, 
  inst_path = "../inst/", 
  raw = TRUE)
#> â„¹ Exporting raw data: usada_prohib_assoc_raw
#> âœ” Exporting raw data: usada_prohib_assoc_raw ... done
#> 
#> âœ” Raw data successfully exported!

    Verify:

    fs::dir_tree(
  path = "../inst/extdata/raw/", 
  regexp = "assoc_raw"
  )
#> ../inst/extdata/raw/
#> â”œâ”€â”€ 2023-01-21_usada_prohib_assoc_raw.csv
#> â”œâ”€â”€ 2023-01-22_usada_prohib_assoc_raw.csv
#> â””â”€â”€ 2023-01-23_usada_prohib_assoc_raw.csv

    Export processed data

    I want to export the processed data into the inst/extdata/ folder, which I can do using export_extdata(raw = FALSE)

    export_extdata(
  x = usada_prohib_assoc_pro, 
  inst_path = "../inst/", raw = FALSE)
#> â„¹ Exporting data: usada_prohib_assoc_pro
#> âœ” Exporting data: usada_prohib_assoc_pro ... done
#> 
#> âœ” Data successfully exported!

    Verify:

    fs::dir_tree(path = "../inst/extdata/", 
  regexp = "assoc_pro")
#> ../inst/extdata/
#> â””â”€â”€ usada_prohib_assoc_pro.csv
